title: Can Rose hold first-round lead? Can Rory bounce back? Looking ahead to Friday at the Masters
content: After an eventful first 18 holes, a packed leaderboard at the top features three former winners, including Scottie Scheffler, who is searching for his third green jacket in four years.

title: Rose masters greens, leads by 3; Rory trips late
content: Justin Rose needed just 22 putts for a 7-under 65 and a three-shot lead at the Masters, while Rory McIlroy had two double bogeys in the final four holes to finish at even par.

title: Ja doing grenade celebration until it's 'a problem'
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant, recently fined for mimicking pointing a long gun after a 3-pointer, said mimicking a grenade toss was "my celebration now until somebody else has a problem with it, and I'll find another one."

title: Salah signs two-year Liverpool contract extension
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has signed a contract extension, ending monthslong uncertainty over his future at Anfield, the club announced.

title: NFL draft prospect Bond surrenders on warrant
content: NFL draft prospect Isaiah Bond turned himself in on an outstanding sexual assault warrant Thursday morning, the Frisco (Texas) Police Department confirmed to ESPN.

title: Capitals celebrate Ovi's record, wrap up top seed
content: The Washington Capitals wrapped up the top spot in the Eastern Conference while celebrating Alex Ovechkin's first game at home since breaking the goals record.

title: Amateur takes relief with Rae's Creek potty break
content: Amateur Jose Luis Ballester, who plays at Arizona State, was in need of a bathroom break during his first Masters round and decided to relieve himself in Rae's Creek.

title: Colts cut kicker Gay two years after big contract
content: The Colts released kicker Matt Gay on Thursday, two years after signing him to a four-year, $22.5 million contract.

title: WMU wins in 2OT, plays BU for Frozen Four title
content: Owen Michaels's double-overtime goal sent Western Michigan to the Frozen Four title game, where it will face Boston University on Saturday night.

title: From The Babe's home run handles to Bonds' maple mashers: A brief history of bats
content: The torpedo is the talk of 2025, but bat experiments have changed baseball and created controversy for 150 years.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for every team's 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: McIlroy vs. Scheffler: Contrasting styles, but both the clear favorites in Augusta
content: The Masters isn't match play between two golfers. But given their recent performances, Scottie Scheffler and Rory McIlroy both figure to be in the mix when Sunday comes around.

title: Game, set, Matić: Man United's Onana has night to forget
content: André Onana's performance against Lyon for Manchester United could have cost Ruben Amorim's team a chance to qualify for the semifinals of the Europa League.

title: Talking points: Is anyone brave enough to write off Madrid?
content: Three goals are surely enough to see Arsenal through to the semis, right? ESPN's writers tackle that, and some of the other most burning Champions League questions.

title: MLS won't switch to fall/spring schedule before '27
content: MLS has announced that the league will explore a switch to its schedule that would align with the international soccer calendar as early as 2027, as well as possible changes to the format of the regular season and playoffs

title: Amorim 'really confident' in Onana despite gaffes
content: Ruben Amorim says he remains "really confident" in André Onana despite the goalkeeper's two blunders costing Manchester United a crucial Europa League victory against Lyon on Wednesday.

title: Castellanos: 'Uncertainty' over travel ban 'scary'
content: Portland Thorns and Venezuela women's national team forward Deyna Castellanos said she does not know when it will be safe for her to travel outside of the United States due to uncertainty around potential travel bans to the U.S.

title: USMNT, Mexico learn Gold Cup group opponents
content: The United States landed in Group D alongside Haiti, Trinidad and Tobago and Saudi Arabia in Thursday's Concacaf Gold Cup draw, while champions Mexico were placed into Group A with Costa Rica, Suriname, and Dominican Republic.

title: Ex-Madrid, Netherlands coach Beenhakker dies
content: Former Real Madrid and Netherlands coach Leo Beenhakker has died at the age of 82, the LaLiga club said on Thursday.

title: Ange frustrated with 'football gods' after UEL draw
content: Ange Postecoglou has voiced his frustration with Spurs' luck in front of goal during their Europa League quarterfinal first-leg draw with Eintracht Frankfurt.

title: Walker tried to stop Dele Alli red: 'Heart kicked in'
content: Kyle Walker has said his "heart kicked in" when he attempted to persuade the referee to avoid showing Dele Alli a red card on his Como debut.

title: Ohio State's Will Howard believes he's the best QB in this NFL draft class
content: Howard says confidence in himself helped him face adversity, reach NFL draft class with 'unbelievable talent.'

title: Five years since Bahrain 2020: The tech that saved Grosjean's life
content: It's been five years since Romain Grosjean's fiery Bahrain crash. F1's ongoing search for safety saved him.

title: Monaco-inspired Long Beach is now a jewel in IndyCar's crown
content: IndyCar is living the dream of Monaco in Southern California as Long Beach celebrates 50 years of "the race."

title: Our NFL draft experts picked 10-man rosters from the 2025 class: Who has the best superteam?
content: Mel Kiper Jr., Matt Miller, Jordan Reid and Field Yates drafted their own rosters of 2025 draft prospects. Check out all 40 picks -- and vote on the winner.

title: This Klassiker is one Bayern, Dortmund can't afford to lose
content: Saturday's Klassiker isn't first vs. second, but Bayern and Dortmund's seasons hinge on their rivalry match.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG could try to sign Rashford if Villa can't afford him
content: If Aston Villa can't afford to keep Marcus Rashford, PSG will be waiting in the wings. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Experts' picks, best bets: What can Stanionis do vs. favored Ennis?
content: A boxing insider and two former opponents share their thoughts on the Jaron 'Boots' Ennis-Eimantas Stanionis fight.

title: 'Indians deserved it': What Rana allegedly told Headley after 26/11 attack
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, the 64-year-old Canadian of Pakistani origin, was extradited from the US to India to face trial for his role in the 2008 Mumbai attacks, which killed 166 people. Accused of aiding co-conspirator David Headley, Rana allegedly praised the attackers. His extradition, after a lengthy legal battle, is hailed as a major step in securing justice for the victims.

title: Nainar Nagendran files nomination for Tamil Nadu BJP top post
content: Nainar Nagendran, a BJP legislator, has filed his nomination for the party's Tamil Nadu state president election, potentially succeeding K Annamalai. His nomination is backed by key BJP figures. Nagendran's past ties with AIADMK fuel speculation about a possible BJP-AIADMK alliance, especially after Edappadi K Palaniswami's meeting with Amit Shah.

title: Here's why KL Rahul did 'mera ground hai' celebration vs RCB
content: KL Rahul's magnificent unbeaten 93 propelled Delhi Capitals to a six-wicket victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Thursday. Rahul's match-winning knock, combined with his intimate knowledge of the ground, guided his team to victory. He celebrated with a gesture inspired by the movie Kantara, declaring the stadium as his home turf.

title: Social worker assaulted, held 'hostage' by IRCTC pantry staff on Gitanjali Express
content: Passengers on the Gitanjali Express faced consequences for complaining about the food quality and price. IRCTC staffers allegedly assaulted passengers, holding a social worker hostage for over an hour until RPF intervened. Satyajit Burman, the social worker, filed a complaint, leading to a case against seven IRCTC employees.

title: Jeff Bezos’ Mar-a-Lago dinner led to Melania’s $40M Amazon Prime project
content: Melania Trump has secured a $40 million deal with Amazon Prime Video for a documentary chronicling her White House life, directed by Brett Ratner. The film, slated for a mid-2025 release, will feature exclusive insights into her daily life, with appearances by Donald and Barron Trump.

title: Burqa-clad woman stopped from speaking to man from other community in B'luru
content: In Bengaluru's Chandra Layout, police arrested four individuals for moral policing. A woman, wearing a Burqa, was confronted by community members for speaking with a man from a different community while on a scooter. The woman filed a complaint, leading to the arrests, including a juvenile. Authorities confirmed that no violence occurred during the incident. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Delhi businessman kills wife, dumps body in drain
content: In Delhi's Dwarka, a property dealer and his security guard have been arrested for allegedly murdering the dealer's 47-year-old wife, Seema Singh. She was reported missing, and her body was found in a drain on March 15. Identification was made possible through a nose pin, leading police to the husband.

title: 'I was cheated': Eknath Shinde takes veiled dig at 'Fukat Baburao' Uddhav
content: During a rally in Sangola, Eknath Shinde criticized Uddhav Thackeray, accusing him of deceiving people with a facade of innocence and implying they were misled by his seemingly innocent demeanor for years. Shinde inaugurated a Babasaheb Ambedkar statue and memorial, emphasizing his commitment to public service and assuring that schemes like "Ladki Bahin" will continue despite opposition claims.

title: US: We will revoke or deny Visa if your social media posts are in support of ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts can now impact visa decisions. The agency will scrutinize accounts, potentially denying visas or residency to individuals posting content deemed anti-Semitic or supportive of designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah. This policy, effective immediately, extends to student visas and Green Card applications, raising concerns about freedom of expression.

title: 60 Indians forced into 'cyber slavery' rescued from Myanmar; 5 agents held
content: Cybercrime officials rescued 60 Indian nationals from Myanmar, victims of forced cyber slavery under false job promises. Maharashtra Police arrested five agents, including a foreign national, involved in trafficking victims from Thailand to Myanmar. The victims were coerced into carrying out digital arrest and investment scams in guarded compounds controlled by armed groups.

title: Watch: MP hospital's 'Dr Death' seen entering operation theatre wearing suit
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, a fake doctor, Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, is accused of impersonating a British cardiologist and conducting unauthorized heart surgeries at Mission Hospital, leading to seven patient deaths. CCTV footage shows Yadav in formal attire in the operation theatre. Authorities have sealed the cath lab, and Yadav faces charges of forgery and medical negligence.

title: 'Jaat' film holds well but faces competition from 'Good Bad Ugly'
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' is receiving positive reviews after its theatrical release, following the success of 'Gadar 2'. The film earned Rs 9.5 crore on its opening day, performing well in northern regions. However, it faces competition from Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly' in the south. By Friday afternoon, 'Jaat' had collected Rs 1.39 crore, bringing its total to Rs 10.

title: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath to investors: Over the next 10 days, there are only ...
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath advises investors to pause trading during the upcoming truncated weeks due to heightened market volatility. He emphasizes the importance of mental preparedness and suggests using the break to recharge. Kamath warns against trading in unfavorable conditions, highlighting that staying out allows for future trading opportunities when both mental state and market conditions are optimal.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife shares what he did after his victory over Blues
content: Connor McDavid made a surprise return against the St. Louis Blues. His wife, Lauren Kyle, shared a picture of him relaxing at home with their dog after the game. McDavid had been out with an injury. The Oilers had lost two of their last three games before his return. Coach Kris Knoblauch said McDavid insisted on playing.

title: 'Woman herself invited trouble': Allahabad HC grants bail to rape accused
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a rape accused, stating the victim 'invited trouble' by going to a bar, consuming alcohol, and then accompanying the accused. The court noted the victim's maturity as a postgraduate student and the lack of conclusive medical evidence of sexual assault.

title: 'Parivar ka saath, parivar ka vikas': PM Modi's dig at opposition in Varanasi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Varanasi, criticized opposition parties for prioritizing family interests over public service, emphasizing his government's commitment to inclusive development. He inaugurated multiple projects worth Rs 3,880 crore, highlighting Varanasi's transformation into a healthcare hub and a model for blending development with heritage. Modi also mentioned India's efforts to host the 2036 Olympic Games.

title: Xi Jinping warns of ‘self-isolation’ in first response to Trump tariffs
content: President Xi Jinping has cautioned against tariff wars, emphasizing that confrontation within the international community could lead to isolation. He urged the EU to join China in opposing unilateralism and economic coercion, implicitly referencing the United States' trade policies.

title: After being caught cheating, Class 7 student hits teacher with iron rod
content: In Hyderabad, a 12-year-old government school student attacked a teacher with an iron rod after being caught cheating during final exams. The teacher sustained a minor head injury but is out of danger. While an assault case was registered, the teacher is considering withdrawing the complaint, but the juvenile will be produced before the juvenile justice board.

title: Rahul poses 3 questions on jobs to PM; BJP calls it 'strategy to distort reality'
content: Rahul Gandhi has criticized PM Modi's commitment to tackling unemployment, alleging the abandonment of the 'Employment Linked Incentive' scheme. He accused Modi of favoring big corporations over small businesses. The BJP retaliated, citing significant job creation under Modi's government and a decrease in youth unemployment, while also defending the ELI program and attacking Congress's past record.

title: Stock market today: Sensex surges over 1,100 points, Nifty nears 22,700
content: Indian equity markets surged on Friday, mirroring a global rebound and fueled by value buying across sectors. The Sensex soared over 1244 points, while the Nifty 50 climbed more than 400 points, driven by positive domestic cues and expectations of steady inflation. Experts suggest long-term investors consider selective buying in financials and pharmaceuticals.

title: Legs, waist shackled: US releases first pic of Tahawwur Rana’s handover to NIA
content: In a significant step towards justice for the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, the United States has extradited Tahawwur Hussain Rana to India. Rana, a key accused, faces multiple charges including conspiracy and murder for his alleged role in the attacks. The extradition follows years of legal proceedings and marks a critical moment for the victims and their families.

title: 'Toilet King of Punjab': CM Mann, AAP trolled over restroom inauguration plaques
content: The Punjab government's 'Sikhya Kranti' initiative is facing social media backlash for installing inauguration plaques even for minor repairs like school toilets. Critics accuse AAP leaders of seeking undue credit and wasting taxpayer money.

title: 'Gauti bhai has helped me understand my potential': Washington Sundar
content: Washington Sundar, a versatile all-rounder, faces the challenge of limited game time in the IPL. Despite his ability to bat anywhere and bowl anytime, he's struggled for consistent opportunities. In a candid interview with the TimesofIndia.com, the 25-year-old speaks on the Impact Player rule, the difficulties of maintaining rhythm, and the crucial support from India head coach Gautam Gambhir.

title: Son of vegetable vendor breaks national archery record at just 11
content: Sohit Kumar, an 11-year-old archer from Jabalpur, has set a national record by scoring 710 out of 720 points at the Under-15 National Archery Championship. Overcoming adversity, with his father selling vegetables on crutches, Sohit aims for the 2028 LA Olympics. His coach recognized his exceptional talent, paving the way for his early entry into the archery academy.

title: CSK vs KKR: Team prediction, pitch report, weather update
content: MS Dhoni is set to captain Chennai Super Kings against Kolkata Knight Riders after Ruturaj Gaikwad was ruled out due to an elbow fracture. CSK coach Stephen Fleming confirmed Gaikwad's injury, sustained in Guwahati. Dhoni, who handed over the captaincy to Gaikwad this season, previously led CSK to five IPL titles.

title: Who was Agustín Escobar? Siemens executive killed with family in NYC helicopter crash
content: A sightseeing helicopter tour over New York ended tragically when it crashed into the Hudson River, killing all six people on board. Among the deceased were Agustín Escobar, a high-profile Siemens executive, his wife, and their three young children. The helicopter went down near Pier 40 after a section of the rotor broke off mid-air.

title: Meat diet vs vegan diet: Twin's experiment uncovers ‘shocking results’
content: The Turner Twins did a new health experiment. This time, Ross and Hugo compared meat and vegan diets. They checked how these diets affected their vitamin levels. Hugo followed a vegan diet. Ross ate a meat-based diet. After six months, tests showed plant-based vitamins had positive effects. Hugo's Omega-3 and D3 levels improved. However, Hugo struggled with the vegan diet.

title: Thunderstorm, lightning strike claim 50 lives in Bihar, UP, Uttarakhand
content: Severe weather, including thunderstorms and lightning, led to at least 50 fatalities across Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Uttarakhand on Thursday. Bihar reported 27 deaths, while UP saw 22, primarily from lightning strikes. Authorities issued alerts and announced compensation for the victims' families, as the storms also caused significant damage to infrastructure.

title: 'Mera ground hai ye': KL Rahul makes a bold statement after his heroics
content: KL Rahul's unbeaten 93 guided Delhi Capitals to a six-wicket victory against Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. Rahul, after hitting the winning run, declared the ground his own, emphasizing his familiarity with the pitch. His composed innings, combined with his understanding of the wicket from behind the stumps, proved crucial in chasing the modest target of 164.

title: Umrah vs Hajj visas: Key differences and common mistakes to avoid
content: Saudi Arabia is enforcing stricter regulations to prevent misuse of Umrah and visit visas for Hajj. Understanding the differences between Hajj and Umrah visas is now crucial for Indian pilgrims.

title: 'Maa, I’m going to sleep forever': Man dies by suicide in UP, blames wife for harassment
content: Raj Arya, a 24-year-old from Bareilly, allegedly died by suicide following marital discord. His family accuses his wife, Simran, of harassment, claiming tensions rose after they both lost their jobs and she left their home. Simran's Instagram posts hinting at legal action preceded Raj's death, prompting a police investigation and a post-mortem examination.

title: Video shows helicopter 'falling apart' midair, splashing into river in NYC
content: A tragic helicopter crash in the Hudson River claimed the lives of six people, including a tech executive from Spain, his wife, their three children, and the pilot. Witnesses reported seeing the helicopter break apart mid-air before plummeting into the water near Pier 40.

title: Asian shares plunge as US markets reverse gains: 10 things to know
content: Asian markets faced a sharp decline due to escalating US-China trade tensions. Tokyo's Nikkei 225 index significantly dropped. Investors rushed to safer assets like yen and gold. President Trump's tariff hikes on Chinese goods triggered retaliatory measures from Beijing. Wall Street also experienced a major sell-off. Global talks are expected as countries seek to address trade imbalances.

title: Knives, tobacco, condom packets found in class 8-10 students' bags at school
content: A private school in Nashik's Ghoti village discovered knives, knuckledusters, and other concerning items during routine bag checks. School authorities have been conducting these checks for seven years, informing parents and counseling students. The initiative aims to curb misbehavior and guide students away from harmful influences. Police confirmed the seizure of weapons and tobacco pouches, urging students to avoid vices.

title: 'No IPL franchise has any right to say, I want this kind of a pitch'
content: Despite debates over home advantage in the IPL, Gujarat Titans COO emphasizes that pitch conditions are standardized for all teams. Home advantage should stem from familiarity with the stadium and local conditions.

title: Want to own land on the Moon? Know the process and other important information
content: Fueled by advancements in space exploration and India's successful Chandrayaan-3 mission, lunar land ownership is gaining traction. Individuals can purchase plots in locations like the Bay of Rainbows and the Sea of Rains, driven by space travel excitement, future settlement potential, and collectible investment appeal. Increased demand has led to processing delays for lunar land purchases.

title: 'There will be transition cost': Trump holds ground on tariffs as markets falter
content: Amidst ongoing trade tensions, President Trump acknowledged potential "transition costs" from his tariff policies, aiming to reshape the global economy by incentivizing US-based manufacturing. Despite raising tariffs on China, including those impacting fentanyl production, Trump expressed optimism for a future agreement. China retaliated with increased tariffs on American goods, while the EU paused planned countermeasures to allow for negotiations.

title: Heatwave persists in Delhi, but rain offers late respite
content: Delhi endured a second consecutive 'warm night' and heatwave conditions in some areas on Thursday. A brief, intense rain spell with winds up to 50 kmph brought significant relief, dropping temperatures by 6-10 degrees. The IMD forecasts light rain or drizzle, ruling out heatwaves until April 16. While Safdarjung's maximum was 39.6°C, Ayanagar and Ridge experienced heatwave conditions.

title: Rashid Latif on IPL vs PSL debate: 'PSL not even in top-five leagues'
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif criticised Pakistan Super League (PSL) team owners and the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), claiming they have damaged the PSL brand. He asserted that the Indian Premier League (IPL) has grown larger and more successful with each season, while the PSL has deteriorated, mirroring the decline of the Pakistan cricket team.

title: Canadian comic depicts Trump as supervillain, Musk his loyal sidekick
content: Amidst heightened political tensions between Canada and the U.S. under Donald Trump, Captain Canuck, a 1970s Canadian comic book hero, is experiencing a resurgence. The character, symbolizing Canadian sovereignty, has become a cultural icon. Creator Richard Comely notes a surge in national pride, with Canadians viewing Captain Canuck as a symbol of independence.

title: Thunderstorm, lightning claim 54 lives in a day in 4 states
content: Severe thunderstorms and lightning strikes claimed 27 lives across Bihar, with Nalanda district being the hardest hit, reporting 20 fatalities. The disaster management department had issued warnings prior to the event, advising residents to stay indoors. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar expressed condolences and announced compensation for the victims' families.

title: SC directs Centre, Bihar Govt to report on clearing illegal constructions along Ganges banks
content: A Bench also sought to know the number of existing encroachments as on date aside from the manner and time period in which the authorities proposed to remove them

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra moves SC challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: Ms. Moitra, who filed her plea on April 9, has said the controversial amendment not only suffered from serious procedural lapses but also violated several fundamental rights enshrined in the Constitution

title: Satara ruler Pratapsinh Bhosale started 1st school for women, Mahatma Phule emulated him: Udayanraje
content: Mr. Bhosale's remarks drew a sharp reaction from the opposition with Maharashtra Congress president Harshvardhan Sapkal accusing him of distorting history

title: Railways earned additional ₹8,913 crore in five years by withdrawing senior citizens' concession: RTI
content: The data of passengers as well as revenue generated from them suggested that 31.35 crore senior citizens travelled paying an additional amount of ₹8,913 crore owing to suspension of concessions

title: More than 60 Indians forced into ‘cyber slavery’ rescued from Myanmar; 5 arrested
content: Maharashtra cyber wing-police rescues Indian nationals trafficked to Myanmar for cyber fraud; arrests agents and foreign national

title: Caste census report placed before Karnataka Cabinet
content: It has been nearly a decade since the survey was completed, but discussions around it has been delayed owing to pressure from the dominant Vokkaliga and Lingayat communities

title: CMRL pay-off case: Special Court to issue notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s daughter Veena Thaikkandiyil
content: Decision to issue notice was taken after court found that prima-facie offence was made out against the respondents after perusing final complaint filed by SFIO

title: Transshipment cargo from Bangladesh grew by 46% from FY24 to FY25 at Bengal’s Petrapole: Official data
content: India had allowed transshipment of export cargo from Bangladesh to third countries via Indian land customs stations, and subsequently through Indian ports and airports since June 29, 2020

title: Massive security and traffic arrangements across Hyderabad for Hanuman Jayanti and IPL Match on Saturday
content: Nampally is likely to see traffic congestion as a public meeting titled ‘The Waqf Protection: Future Challenges and Roadmap’ is scheduled at 7 p.m. at Nehru Auditorium

title: Nainar Nagenthran to be 13th Tamil Nadu BJP president
content: According to party sources, Mr. Nagenthran was the only person to file nominations for the post of the party’s State president

title: MUMBAI 1, single card for public transportation in Mumbai to be launched soon
content: CM Fadnavis said that the single card can be used for travelling by Metro, Mono Rail, suburban local trains and public transport buses and added the “architecture” of the card will be ready in a month

title: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq claims he is under house arrest, was prevented from offering Friday prayers
content: The Mirwaiz posted a copy of a resolution formulated by the Mutahida Majlis Ulema (MMU) -- an amalgam of several religious bodies -- against the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: At least 25 killed in lightning strikes, hailstorms in several districts of Bihar
content: The IMD has issued an ‘orange alert’ for a number of districts, including Darbhanga, East Champaran, Nalanda and Patna; forecast heavy rainfall April 10 and April 11

title: India sees “urgency” in finalising US, UK, EU trade pacts: S. Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar said that the US’s tariffs have “focused our minds on the need for correcting a certain skewed nature of our openness to the global economy”.

title: 26/11 Mumbai attacks: Tahawwur Rana likely devised similar plans for other cities, NIA to court
content: The NIA said Rana’s custody was required to piece together the full scope of the conspiracy, and submitted he was required to be taken to various locations for retracing the events that took place 17 years ago

title: PM Modi pushes for ‘strictest action’ in Varanasi gangrape case
content: Mr. Modi is on a one-day visit to his parliamentary constituency, Varanasi, in Uttar Pradesh. This is his 50th visit to the Lok Sabha seat he has represented since 2014.

title: Fire engulfs three floors of residential tower in Surat, 18 rescued
content: The fire started around 8 a.m. on the seventh floor of the multi-storey Happy Excellencia building located in the city’s Vesu area and soon engulfed two more top floors

title: Dhinakaran wants Ponmudy dropped from Cabinet over misogynist remarks
content: “The indecent remarks made by Minister Ponmudy on women are condemnable. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin should think about whether he should continue to be a Minister,” Mr. Dhinakaran said in a social media post

title: Centre giving coarse rice and not fine rice: Telangana Civil Supplies Minister to BJP
content: A Tricolour Card will be issued to families below the poverty line, while those above the poverty line will receive a Green Card

title: Duraimurugan issues apology to persons with disabilities over offensive remarks
content: Mr. Duraimurugan said: “I was shocked, and I regret it. It is wrong that someone who was nurtured by Kalaignar did this.”

title: Bengal teachers who lost jobs hold march demanding release of OMR sheets
content: A large police contingent, including personnel from the Rapid Action Force, was deployed to prevent the rally from reaching the SSC Bhawan.

title: West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari visits clash-hit Mothabari in Malda
content: "Keep faith in the law," Suvendu Adhikari told the affected families, while asking them to stay united

title: Sivaji Ganesan’s bungalow case: Elder son Ramkumar files affidavit in favour of brother Prabhu
content: However, a finance company expresses doubts whether Mr. Ramkumar would have actually relinquished all his rights over the property worth several crores of rupees

title: Tahawwur Rana extradition: 2008 Mumbai attack accused back in India after 17 years | Timeline
content: A team led by NIA authorities landed in India late Thursday with Rana who will now face justice for his role and involvement in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks carried out by Pakistan based terrorists.

title: Missing since March 29, Hungarian tourist’s body found in Meghalaya
content: Police said Puskas Zsolt, suffering from rheumatoid arthritis, may have slipped and fallen from a path off the usual trekking trails in the Sohra-Shella area

title: Kerala court sentences man to life for raping COVID-19 patient in ambulance
content: Principal Sessions Court in Pathanamthitta orders convict, Noufal of Kayamkulam, to pay a fine of ₹2.12 lakh

title: Militant killed in ongoing operation in J&K’s Kishtwar
content: According to the Army, the joint operations in Chenab Valley’s Kishtwar in J&K has been going on from April 9.

title: Employment Linked Incentive scheme: Rahul Gandhi slams PM Modi; says ‘another jumla’
content: Rahul Gandhi said jobs can't be created by focussing only on large corporates, promoting cronies over fair-play businesses, prioritising assembly over production, and disregarding India's indigenous skills

title: Self-immolation bid by two near Bapatla railway station, one critical
content: The two persons were identified as Lakshminarayana, 67, a retired railway employee, and Nallamothu Madhavi aged 56.

title: SFI turning antisocial with CPI(M) support, alleges V.D. Satheesan
content: Kerala Opposition Leader urges CPI(M) to advise its student members to correct their ways ‘before things spiral further out of control’

title: ‘Alappuzha Gymkhana’ movie review: Khalid Rahman dodges genre coventions to deliver an effective sports comedy
content: Khalid Rahman’s ‘Alappuzha Gymkhana’ does not deliver many emotional highs but makes up with a relatable tale that spares a thought for those who are not cut out to win

title: U.S. releases images of Rana being handed over to Indian authorities
content: On April 9, the U.S. Marshals Service executed the Secretary’s surrender warrant by surrendering Rana to Indian authorities for transportation to India. Rana’s extradition is now complete.

title: Wayanad township: Kerala HC allows govt to take possession of Elstone estate land on depositing ₹17 crore more as compensation
content: Interim order on petition by Elstone Tea Estate seeking directive to Kerala government to pay it the market value of the land being acquired for establishing a township for Wayanad landslide survivors

title: 26/11 attacks shocked entire world; America supports India's pursuit of justice: U.S. on Tahawwur Rana extradition
content: A spokesperson for the U.S. Department of Justice said in a statement that Rana’s extradition is a “critical step toward seeking justice” for the victims of the heinous attacks

title: The sanitised memorial at Jallianwala Bagh sparks debate over authenticity
content: April 13, 2025 marks the 106th anniversary of the massacre that killed nearly 1,500 people as per estimates

title: T.N. Minister Ponmudy stripped of DMK top post after misogynistic remarks
content: DMK deputy general secretary and MP Kanimozhi had condemned certain controversial remarks made by senior party leader and Minister K. Ponmudy in a public forum

title: Chautala, Hooda trade charges over helping the BJP in Haryana
content: In an obvious reference to corruption cases against Bhupinder Hooda, former Haryana Leader of the Opposition Abhay Chautala alleged that Mr. Hooda had joined hands with the BJP to avoid going to jail and betrayed the people of the State.

title: Star Air to upgrade Kalaburagi-Bengaluru flight to daily service from April 16
content: According to KKCCI, the decision by the airline was a significant move in boosting regional air connectivity and, thus, trade and commerce activities in the region.

title: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw showcases new Aadhaar app for instant authentication
content: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday showcased a new Aadhaar app that features QR code-based instant verification and real-time face ID for authentication

title: Trade wars benefit no one: Italian Deputy PM and Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani
content: Italian FM lands in Delhi for talks with EAM Jaishankar and Commerce Minister Goyal, pitches for IMEC, BTIA

title: PM Modi inaugurates multiple projects in Varanasi, takes dig at opposition parties
content: Immediately after landing in Varanasi, the PM received a detailed briefing on the alleged gang-rape of a young woman and asked officials to take strict action

title: Living with leopards in Mysuru
content: Contrary to prevailing narrative, it is not leopards straying into villages or cities, but humans intruding in to their territory that has increased sightings and augmented conflict

title: Officials told to ready action plan to develop Rushikonda, Sagar Nagar beaches
content: Rushikonda beach can be equipped with additional amenities and a tourist information centre, says Collector Harendhira Prasad

title: A lethal dose of silence
content: On April 4, a young pharmacist breathed her last following an attempt to end her life 11 days earlier. In a letter found buried in a work diary, she narrates how torture, exploitation and manipulation drove her to take the extreme step. T. Appala Naidu visits a devastated family in a remote village and learns how the 24-year-old suffered it all in silence until it was too much

title: Prajavani effect: When the walls came down, unheard voices found their way in
content: For a decade, citizens in Telangana had no direct line to power, their pleas often lost in bureaucratic silence. But with Prajavani, the Congress government has created a window for the people to speak and be heard. This structured grievance redressal platform has not only reopened the gates of governance, but also ensured accountability, with over 66% of petitions addressed so far. As common people line up with old documents and new hope, a long-overdue conversation between the State and its citizens has finally begun, reports M. Rajeev

title: In the age of age-tech: How Bengaluru’s elderly are getting empowered
content: With social structures changing and families shrinking, many senior citizens are nagged by questions on how to productively use the silver years without feeling isolated or burdening others. Shilpa Elizabeth looks at age-tech, a new and emerging sector that harnesses technology to seek some answers

title: Trinamool Congress playing role of pre-Independence Muslim League: Tarun Chugh
content: He alleged that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is misleading the people over Waqf Act and called her ‘Jinnah of modern India’

title: ‘Land-holding farmers doing non-farming activities improve labour efficiency’
content: Study by National Law School of India University and IIT-Madras researchers finds farmers’ move affects farm operations positively

title: Madhya Pradesh will have better national highway network than U.S. in two years, says Gadkari
content: Union Minister inaugurates projects worth ₹5,800 crore in the State, the 10 projects will add 328 kilometres to the State’s national highway network.

title: Telangana government clears air on 400 acres to empowered committee
content: The officials asserted before the panel that there was need for development by following all the laid down guidelines and rules

title: BRS represents violations in case of Kancha Gachibowli land to SC appointed CEC
content: Party leaders say 7 laws were violated in felling trees, killing wild animals; 11-page representation submitted with 200 pages of support/evidence documents

title: 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana sent to 18-day NIA custody
content: Rana will be kept in a highly secured cell inside the anti-terror agency’s head office at CGO complex

title: West Bengal will introduce a motion against the Waqf Act, says Minister
content: Minister Siddiqullah Chowdhury said that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has agreed to introduce a resolution opposing The Waqf (Amendment) Act

title: The old city changeth, yielding place to new
content: Srinagar’s horizontal skyline is changing to vertical, with new land laws and fresh aspirations. With many in the city alarmed that this will change the nature of the city from historic and craft-driven to chaotic, several residents are enjoying the benefits of condominium-living, finds Peerzada Ashiq

title: YSRCP, TDP corporators ‘shifted’ abroad ahead of no-trust move against Vizag Mayor
content: It is learnt that the YSRCP corporators have now been shifted to Sri Lanka while  the TDP has started shifting its corporators to Malaysia

title: Waqf tribunal to conduct fresh check of documents on disputed land in Munambam
content: The tribunal observed that the Kerala High Court and the Paravur Sub Court had looked into the existing ownership details of the property alone, and that more examinations were required to verify claims related to its past ownership

title: ACA mourns death of ex-Andhra Ranji captain
content: Yachendra, who played 15 Ranji Trophy matches, led the Andhra cricket team from 1963–65, passed away at 93

title: China Raises Tariffs On US Goods To 125% As Trade War Worsens
content: China's action came after Donald Trump raised the tariffs for Beijing to 145 per cent, further escalating the ongoing trade war between the top two economies.

title: After India Outreach, China Calls On Europe To Resist American "Bullying"
content: China has called on the European Union to join hands to resist "unilateral bullying" by the US, referring to the sweeping (and staggering) 145 per cent tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Chinese imports.

title: In Hyderabad University Land Row, KTR's "Mastermind" Jab At Revanth Reddy
content: The Revanth Reddy vs KTR feud escalated after the BRS leader named the Telangana Chief Minister as the "mastermind and sole beneficiary" of an alleged Rs 10,000 crore scam linked to the development of 400 acres near Hyderabad Central University.

title: 14x14 Ft Cell, 24-Hour Surveillance: How Tahawwur Rana Is Being Held
content: Measuring just 14 feet by 14 feet, this cell - under CCTV and manned by round-the-clock guards - is where Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, is being held.

title: Who Was Agustin Escobar, Siemens Executive Killed In New York Chopper Crash
content: Agustin Escobar, a top Spanish executive at technology company Siemens, was among six people killed in a helicopter crash on Thursday.

title: Tamil Minister's "Disgusting" Comment On Sex Workers Triggers Furious Row
content: Tamil Nadu's Forest Minister K Ponmudy's misogynistic remarks - laced with caste undertones - have landed Chief Minister MK Stalin in trouble, inviting fierce criticism from women's rights activists, the opposition, and within his DMK.

title: 'Have Any Shame?': Couple, Sitting On Scooter In Bengaluru, Assaulted
content: The video shows the man, wearing an orange t-shirt, and the woman, wearing a burqa, in a heated exchange with some men, one of whom was seen to be capturing a video of the woman.

title: Opinion: As Tahawwur Rana Talks, Pakistan Had Better Lend An Ear
content: One can hardly say that "the eagle has landed" in the manner of spy thrillers. Intel coding for movement to India of a despised terrorist would be more like, "the carrion crow has been shackled".

title: Asia Has World's Best 3 Airports - Singapore, Doha, And...
content: Asia is home to the world's three best airports, according to a UK-based aviation rating platform. At the Skytrax World Airport Awards held at Passenger Terminal EXPO in Madrid on April 9, Singapore Changi Airport was named the best Airport in 2025.

title: Kohli Unhappy With Patidar? Animated Karthik Discussion Fuels Speculations
content: Virat Kohli had an animated discussion with RCB coach Dinesh Karthik on the sidelines, seemingly expressing his displeasure at some of the decisions taken by skipper Rajat Patidar in the middle.

title: "That Is Not Acceptable": Fuming Rajat Patidar Puts Blame Of Defeat On...
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper Rajat Patidar was not amused with the way his batters threw away their wickets in a heap when thing were cruise control.

title: Fresh Images Show Tahawwur Rana Being Handed Over To Indian Officers
content: Hours after Tahawwur Rana, accused of playing a big role in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, was brought to India, fresh images have emerged of US Marshals handing him over to Indian authorities for extradition.

title: This Hyderabad Man Claims Hes The Real Heir To Taj Mahal
content: As the sixth-generation heir of Bahadur Shah Zafar, the last Mughal emperor, Prince Yakub Habeebuddin Tucy believes he's the owner of India's most iconic monument, the Taj Mahal.

title: Senators Accuse Trump Of Insider Trading After Dramatic Tariff Flip-Flop
content: Several US senators have called for an investigation into whether President Donald Trump engaged in insider trading or market manipulation by encouraging people to buy stocks just before his dramatic reversal on global tariffs.

title: Rana’s extradition manifestation of Modi’s firm action against terrorism: BJP
content: The party says the motto of new India is neither to forgive and nor forget the terrorists; track them down wherever they are and make them face the law

title: Watch: FOMO FIX | Episode 2: The White Lotus finale - Opt for Therapy or Severance?
content: If you started the week with The White Lotus finale, chances are everything since has felt like a slow slide downhill. We’re here to fix that

title: Kuki bodies tell Meiteis not to climb hill for annual event
content: Curfew continues in some parts of Churachandpur district after conflict over hoisting community flags in a disputed area

title: In Tahawwur Rana Probe, An ISI Link, And Two Names: Major Iqbal, Sameer Ali
content: As Tahawwur Hussain Rana, key conspirator in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, sits in a high-security cell in New Delhi, fresh interrogations and years-old indictments are peeling back layers of one of the most high-profile cases in Indian history.

title: Opinion: As Tahawwur Rana Talks, Pakistan Had Better Lend An Ear
content: One can hardly say that "the eagle has landed" in the manner of spy thrillers. Intel coding for movement to India of a despised terrorist would be more like, "the carrion crow has been shackled".

title: Power Rankings: Mets, Cubs make huge leaps in Week 2

title: Fans in Dallas, still outraged, cheer Doncic's homecoming
content: los Angeles lakers came to town for the first time since the stunning trade that sent Luka Doni away . a small crowd stood on high alert outside the American Airlines Center, searching for any sign that the man of the moment had arrived . "There's Luka!" one fan shouted while pointing toward Dirk Nowitzki Way .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up at the end of the regular season
content: the 2024-25 season wraps up Sunday but all eyes will be on Wednesday's clash with the Dallas Mavericks . the Sacramento Kings host the Denver Nuggets (ESPN, 10:30 p.m. ET), who will take the court for the first time since Tuesday's firing of an NBA coach . top playoff contenders are aiming to lock up their postseason spots .

title: Mbappé lawyers have court seize €55m from PSG
content: the french striker argues he owes him €55 million ($61m) in unpaid wages . his lawyers claim they have asked the court to start proceedings . a legal hearing is scheduled for may 26 .
